elements.title: bucket hats (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that giant bucket hats (pictured) were placed around Wales and in Qatar to mark Wales' football team reaching the 2022 FIFA World Cup?

elements.title: Yerko Núñez (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after he, his father, and his grandfather won the Rurrenabaque mayoralty as MNR members, Yerko Núñez switched parties and won a third term, defeating the MNR by a margin of 3,476 votes to 30?

elements.title: New Body Rhumba (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that LCD Soundsystem recorded for the first time in five years by making the song "New Body Rhumba" for the 2022 film White Noise?

elements.title: Syndicate (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Syndicate was the first to reach 1 million followers on Twitch, beating League of Legends developer Riot Games to the record?

elements.title: spoke Vietnamese (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that when students spoke Vietnamese in a graduation speech in Louisiana, the school district proposed banning all non-English languages?

elements.title: Cameron Shahbazi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in 2020 when Persian-Canadian countertenor Cameron Shahbazi performed in Written on Skin in Cologne, his "Luciferian charm" and "iridescent voice" were noted?

elements.title: Lieutenant Governor of North Carolina (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Lieutenant Governor of North Carolina, uniquely within the Council of State, has powers in both the executive and legislative branches of government?

elements.title: the radio station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a woman hitchhiked from Indiana to Washington, D.C., to protest the sale of the radio station where she worked?
